latest news.summary: Checkers and OK Foods have recalled three batches of their Deli branded label hummus due to microbiological contamination. The affected products, including Hummus, Reduced Fat Hummus, Zataar Hummus, Red Pepper Hummus, and Caramelised Onion Hummus, have a sell-by date between September 10 and October 8, 2024. According to a statement, 'All production at the supplier has been halted.' Customers who have purchased these products are advised not to consume them and to return them to their nearest Checkers supermarket or OK Foods for a full refund. Checkers has assured customers that it is committed to maintaining the highest standards of food safety and ensuring that only top-quality products reach its customers.'
latest news.title: Supermarkets recall contaminated hummus

latest news.eng_title: Waffles recalled in multiple states due to plastic contamination
latest news.summary: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has issued a voluntary recall of 7,300 boxes of Kodiak Cakes LLC's 'Kodiak Protein-Packed Power Waffles, Buttermilk & Vanilla' due to the presence of soft plastic film in the products. The recall affects multiple states, including Kansas, Iowa, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, North Dakota, Nebraska, Ohio, South Dakota, and Wisconsin. The recalled waffles have a UPC code of '7 05599 01920 3', expire on Jan. 1, 2026, and come in 53.6 oz containers. The FDA has designated the recall as a 'Class II' status, meaning the waffles may cause adverse health reactions in those who come into contact with them.
latest news.title: Waffles recalled in multiple states due to plastic contamination

latest news.eng_title: Popular mac and cheese brand recalled from major US stores over spoilage fears

Product: American Classics Macaroni and Cheese White Cheddar

latest news.summary: Reser's Fine Foods has recalled two macaroni and cheese products, 'Reser's American Classics Macaroni and Cheese' and 'Reser's American Classics Macaroni and Cheese White Cheddar,' due to concerns of potential bacteria contamination. The recall was initiated on July 29 and affects products with 'use by' dates of September 11, 14, and 16, 2024. The products were sold in California, Illinois, Minnesota, North Dakota, and South Dakota, but major retailers such as Safeway, Stop & Shop, and Walmart were not affected. This recall comes amid a series of health and safety concerns, including a listeria outbreak from Boar's Head deli meats, a recall of Perdue Foods' frozen chicken nuggets, and a recall of eggs in Wisconsin due to salmonella infections.
latest news.title: Popular mac and cheese brand recalled from major US stores over spoilage fears

latest news.eng_title: Walmart and Target Recall Mac Cheese Products Due to Possible Contamination
latest news.summary: Walmart and Target, two major American companies, have announced the removal of two products from their stores due to possible contamination. The products, Reser's American Classics Macaroni & Cheese and Reser's American Classics Macaroni & Cheese White Cheddar, have been recalled by the FDA due to a malfunctioning refrigeration unit in a trailer. According to the FDA, 'the use or exposure to a violative product may cause temporary adverse health consequences that are medically reversible.' The recall began on July 29 and affects products with expiration dates of September 16 and 11. As stated by the FDA, 'this is a situation in which the use or exposure to a violative product may cause temporary or medically reversible adverse health consequences.'
latest news.title: Walmart y Target: estos son los 2 productos que serán retirados de las tiendas por posible contaminación

latest news.eng_title: Nearly a ton of sausages recalled due to mislabeling

Organization: U.S. Food Safety and Inspection Service

latest news.summary: The Dearborn Sausage Company, Inc. has issued a recall of approximately 1,944 pounds of ready-to-eat wiener products due to misbranding and undeclared allergens. The U.S. Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) stated that the labels of the two products implicated in the recall were inadvertently swapped, resulting in soy and pork not being declared on the product labels. The products were produced on August 7, 2024, and bear the establishment number 'EST. 10002' inside the USDA mark of inspection. Consumers who have purchased these products are urged not to consume them, but instead throw them away or return them to the place of purchase.
latest news.title: Nearly a ton of sausages recalled due to mislabeling

latest news.eng_title: The 5 Largest Food Recalls in History
latest news.summary: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) investigate outbreaks of illness to determine the cause and issue recalls of food products. The five largest food recalls in U.S. history include the Hallmark/Westland Meat Packing beef recall, which involved 143 million pounds of beef, the Peanut Corporation of America recall, which led to 3,900 products being recalled and over $1 billion in financial damage, the Wright County/Hillandale Farms eggs recall, which affected over 500 million eggs and resulted in 1,900 reports of illness, the Cargill Ground Turkey recall, which involved 36 million pounds of ground turkey and resulted in one death and over 90 illnesses, and the Menu Foods Pet Food recall, which affected over 50 brands of dog food and over 40 brands of cat food and resulted in at least 14 reported animal deaths. These recalls highlight the importance of ensuring the nation's food supply is safe and the potential consequences of large-scale recalls, including bankruptcy and loss of consumer confidence.
latest news.title: The 5 Largest Food Recalls in History

latest news.eng_title: Listeria Risk: Recall Issued for Pre-Packaged Iceberg Lettuce and Romaine Lettuce
latest news.summary: The Italian Ministry of Health has issued a recall for various brands of pre-packaged iceberg lettuce and romaine lettuce due to the presence of Listeria monocytogenes. The affected brands include Castello, Foglia Verde Eurospin, Alifresh, Il Mio Orto, Centrale del Latte, Ciro Amodio, Colline Verdi, Natura Chiama Selex, Latte Francia, Mi Mordi, Natura È di Penny Market, Polenghi, Ortoromi, Ortofresco Pulito, Sigma, Très Bon, Torre in Pietra, Tornese, Vivinatura, and Coop. The products were produced by Ortoromi Società Cooperativa Agricola in Bellizzi, Salerno, and have expiration dates ranging from September 12 to September 19, 2024. Coop has announced that the recall only affects some of their stores in central and southern Italy.
latest news.title: Rischio listeria, allarme per l'insalata in busta: ecco i marchi da evitare

latest news.eng_title: Eggs Recalled For Salmonella, Juice Poses Arsenic Risk: Recall Roundup
latest news.summary: Several products, including eggs, fruit, juice, children's toys, high chairs, and other items, have been recalled in recent weeks due to contamination and safety concerns. A Wisconsin-based company, Milo's Poultry Farms, is recalling eggs sold in Wisconsin, Illinois, and Michigan that have been linked to a multi-state Salmonella outbreak, which has sickened 65 people and hospitalized 24. Additionally, apple juice has been recalled due to potentially harmful levels of arsenic, with over 133,500 cases affected. Other recalled products include whole cantaloupe and various toys and children's items. 'The FDA informed the company that environmental samples tested positive for Salmonella bacteria,' said a statement from the FDA. 'We are committed to ensuring the safety of our products and taking swift action when necessary,' added a spokesperson for Refresco Beverages Inc., the company behind the apple juice recall.
latest news.title: Eggs Recalled For Salmonella, Juice Poses Arsenic Risk: Recall Roundup

news knowledge.eng_title: Boar's Head to close Virginia plant linked to deadly listeria outbreak

Organization: US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Title: food safety officer
EST. 12612

news knowledge.summary: Boar's Head will close its Virginia plant linked to a deadly listeria outbreak that hospitalized 57 people in 18 states and killed nine. The company will discontinue sales of liverwurst and appoint a new food safety officer and council. 'We remain steadfast in our commitment to our customers and to the safety and quality of our products,' the company said. The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has advised consumers to check their kitchens for recalled products with 'EST. 12612' or 'P-12612' inside the USDA mark of inspection on labels and have sell-by dates into October 2024.
news knowledge.title: Boar's Head to close Virginia plant linked to deadly listeria outbreak

news knowledge.eng_title: FDA Recalls Apple Juice Due to Excessive Arsenic Levels
news knowledge.summary: The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has recalled several brands of apple juice due to excessive levels of arsenic. The affected brands include Great Value, Market Basket, Weis, Urban Meadow, Natures Nectar, Wellsley Farms, Solevita, and Clover Valley, all of which are manufactured by Refresco Beverages US Inc. According to the FDA, 'the products contain inorganic arsenic above the action level established in the guidelines for the industry.' Prolonged consumption of this substance can cause various types of cancer, particularly lung and skin cancer. The FDA estimates that around 133,500 cases of the affected product were sold through retailers such as Walgreens, Walmart, BJ's, Weis, and Aldi. The affected products were sold in 15 states and Puerto Rico. Refresco Beverages US Inc. has issued a statement saying, 'our top priority is the safety of our consumers.' The company claims that they voluntarily initiated a market withdrawal of some selected lots of apple juice products on August 23, 2024, after discovering that the product contained inorganic arsenic slightly above the FDA's action level of 10 parts per billion established in June 2023. The FDA had previously issued two alerts regarding the issue, but only for the Great Value brand. No cases of illness have been reported in relation to the recall.
news knowledge.title: Retiran un jugo de manzana de Aldi, Walgreens y Weis por presencia de arsénico

news knowledge.eng_title: Eggs Are Being Recalled In 9 States Over Salmonella Concerns
news knowledge.summary: The CDC has issued a food safety alert and recall of eggs produced by Milo's Poultry Farms LLC due to salmonella concerns. Testing confirmed the presence of a specific strain of salmonella bacteria in the facility and areas housing hens. Affected products were sold under Milo's Poultry Farms or Tony's Fresh Market labels and have been reported in nine states, with the majority of cases in Illinois and Wisconsin. According to the CDC, 'Eggs with labels bearing the names Milo's Poultry Farms or Tony's Fresh Market should be discarded immediately, regardless of the expiration date, size, or type of eggs.' While there have been 24 hospitalizations, no deaths have been reported. The recall is part of a larger trend of food recalls in 2024, including well-known brands like Trader Joe's and Great Value.
news knowledge.title: Eggs Are Being Recalled In 9 States Over Salmonella Concerns

news knowledge.eng_title: Urgent warning to shoppers as bargain store recalls popular kids' chocolate treat
news knowledge.summary: Heron Foods has issued an urgent product recall for its Smileys Surprise Egg due to undeclared hazelnuts, posing a serious risk to those with nut allergies. According to the Food Standards Agency, the product contains hazelnuts that are not mentioned on the label, making it a possible health risk for individuals with hazelnut allergies. The agency advises those with allergies not to eat the product and to return it to the store for a full refund. Any size or batch code of the Smileys Surprise Egg is subject to the recall, including items with a 'best before' date of August 30, 2025. Customers can return the affected eggs to any Heron Foods store for a complete refund, regardless of having a receipt. The Food Standards Agency explained that recalls occur when potential risks are identified with products, and that this recall is actioned due to inadequate labelling practices. The agency added that it will issue an Allergy Alert when there is a food allergy risk.
news knowledge.title: Urgent warning to shoppers as bargain store recalls popular kids' chocolate treat

news knowledge.eng_title: Urgent warning as bargain store recalls popular chocolate treat
news knowledge.summary: Heron Foods has issued an urgent warning and recall for its popular Smileys Surprise Egg due to the presence of hazelnuts not listed in the ingredients. According to the Food Standards Agency, 'Heron Foods is recalling The Smileys Surprise Egg because it contains hazelnuts (nuts) which are not mentioned on the label.' Customers with an allergy to hazelnuts are advised not to eat the product and to return it to the store for a full refund. The affected products have a best before date of August 30, 2025, and can be identified by their batch codes and best before dates on the edge of the product. Customers can return the products with or without a receipt and can contact info@heronfoods.com for further information.
news knowledge.title: Urgent warning as bargain store recalls popular chocolate treat

news knowledge.eng_title: Steamed Bun Recall in 27 States As Threat-to-Life Warning Issued

Product: Steam Buns with Egg Custard and Coconut Added
Steam Buns with Egg Custard Added

news knowledge.summary: Prime Foods Processing is recalling 477 cases of its Egg Custard Steamed Buns in 27 states due to potential undeclared sesame, a life-threatening allergen. The products were distributed between May 30, 2024, and June 28, 2024, through grocery stores in states including Arizona, California, and New York. According to the FDA, no consumer complaints or illnesses have been reported, but the company has identified a temporary breakdown in its packaging process as the cause. The FDA and Prime Foods are urging consumers to return the products for a full refund and not to consume them, even if they have already been opened. Symptoms of an allergic reaction include rashes, hives, and anaphylaxis, which can be deadly. The recall affects two specific products: Steam Buns with Egg Custard Added (Item #PD4180) and Steam Buns with Egg Custard and Coconut Added (Item #PD4190), with lot codes #24149 and #24150 and an expiration date of October 2025. 'It is legally required for food manufacturers to clearly label the nine most common allergens on all products,' said the FDA, which sets the rules around food labeling throughout the U.S.
news knowledge.title: Steamed Bun Recall in 27 States As Threat-to-Life Warning Issued

news knowledge.eng_title: Boar's Head Recalls 71 Products in Light of Listeria Outbreak
news knowledge.summary: Boar's Head Provisions Co., Inc. has issued a second product recall due to a Listeria monocytogens outbreak, affecting 71 products made between May 10, 2024, and July 29, 2024. The recall targets 7 million pounds of meat, including sliced deli meats and packaged products, with sell-by dates ranging from July 29 to October 17. According to the USDA's Food Safety and Inspection Service, the affected products were shipped across the U.S. and to several international locations. People who have purchased these products should dispose of them and sanitize their refrigerators and surfaces to avoid cross-contamination. The recall was issued while federal officials were investigating a listeria outbreak that killed two and hospitalized over 30 people across 13 states. To prevent listeria infection, thoroughly clean raw veggies, cook food to proper temperature, and wash surfaces and hands. Signs of a listeria infection include fever, chills, muscle aches, nausea, and diarrhea, which can take more than 30 days to show. Contact your doctor if you've eaten recalled items and are experiencing symptoms.
news knowledge.title: Boar's Head Recalls 71 Products in Light of Listeria Outbreak

news knowledge.eng_title: Boar's Head Expands Recall Of Deli Meat Products Over Listeria Concern
news knowledge.summary: Boar's Head Provisions Co., Inc. is recalling an additional 7 million pounds of ready-to-eat meat and poultry products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall includes 71 products made between May 10 and July 29, with 'sell by' dates from July 29 to October 17. The products were distributed to retail stores across the nation and exported to several countries. As of July 30, 2024, 34 people have been identified as sick in 13 states, with 33 hospitalizations and two deaths. The USDA has urged customers to throw away or return the impacted product, and retailers are requested not to sell the recalled products.
news knowledge.title: Boar's Head Expands Recall Of Deli Meat Products Over Listeria Concern

news knowledge.eng_title: Stop & Shop closes all store delis due to recall
news knowledge.summary: Stop & Shop has closed all of its store delis due to a recent recall of certain Boar's Head meat products. The USDA issued a recall for various ready-to-eat meats produced by Boar's Head between June 11 and July 17 due to possible listeria contamination. Stop & Shop is removing all impacted products from its in-store delis and discarding other meats and cheeses that may have been sliced or prepared in the same area. The company will also conduct a deep cleaning of its delis. 'As always, ensuring the safety of the products we sell is our highest priority,' Stop & Shop said in a statement.
news knowledge.title: Stop & Shop closes all store delis due to recall

news knowledge.eng_title: Egg Recall Due to Salmonella Contamination
news knowledge.summary: Several stores, including Axfood, Ica, and Lidl, are recalling eggs due to the discovery of salmonella in the production environment. The recalled products have been sold by many of Axfood's store chains and are now stopped for sale. According to Axfood, the products can pose a health risk, but the salmonella bacteria die when heated to 70 degrees. No cases of illness have been reported. Ica and Lidl are also recalling eggs. 'We take this very seriously and are now investigating with the supplier how this could have happened and how we can ensure it doesn't happen again,' said Niklas Warén, Quality Manager at Ica Sweden. The recalled products include Axfood's Garant Ägg, Ica's Brunchägg, Frukostägg, and Basic ägg, and Lidl's Ägg from free-range hens. The products have a best-before date from July 19, 2024 to August 13, 2024 and have a specific code on the egg.
news knowledge.title: Matjättar återkallar ägg
